title: Good Touch Bad Touch: How To Tell the difference
features: This book will help your child understand the difference between a good touch and a bad touch. This book also instills in your child the importance of consent, not keeping any secrets, and what to do if your child feels that they have been touched inappropriately. Please help all children across the world stay safe because they are our future.
description: Your book said something to me that I needed to hear all my life. That it was not fault. --Sasha B.When reading this book to me granddaughter, I was surprised to see how ashamed she appeared because we talked about this topic numerous amounts of time. --KIm W.I asked my daughter to name three people that were not myself and her dad. I was surprised to see that she said that she would tell her teacher if anyone touched her inappropriately. --Mary H.

Simone Blanchard is Executive Director and Lead Therapist of Inner Light Consulting and Therapeutic Services. She earned her graduate degree with high honors, in Clinical Mental Health Counseling from Marymount University. She was inducted into the following honor societies: Psi Chi International Honors Society in Psychology; Delta Epsilon Sigma National Honors Society. She is a National Certified Counselor (NCC) and currently holds her LCPC (Licensed Clinical Professional Counselor) in the State of Maryland and Washington, DC; she is a Trauma Specialist. Mrs. Blanchard is currently pursuing her PH.D in International Psychology with a special concentration in global trauma. Ms. Blanchard has studied with master practitioners in the fields of spirituality, human development, and restitution. She has served and worked with a wide variety of populations including work with incarcerated persons and their families. She is currently a Program Director for Volunteers of America-Chesapeake for Targeted Case Management. She trains and develops curriculum for Correctional Officers at Prince George s County Correctional Center on important topics such as: suicide prevention and trauma informed care. She has coordinated outreach efforts in Prince George s County, Montgomery County, and Washington, DC to elevate and educate the community on important topics that are affecting our youth.
